project.teaser: CapaCITIES will shape a European environment conducive to urban climate neutrality transitions for national, regional and local authorities. The project aims to initiate and strengthen national change processes by establishing national networks and governance structures and by...
project.objective: CapaCITIES will shape a European environment conducive to urban climate neutrality transitions for national, regional and local authorities. The project aims to initiate and strengthen national change processes by establishing national networks and governance structures and by providing dedicated support for public authorities to put enabling conditions and measures for cities in place for achieving the cities mission. To achieve this ambition, the CapaCITIES consortium represents 15 European countries who have committed to initiative and strengthen national change processes by ministerial or other high political level. CapaCITIES thereby build on a well-established network of national authorities (national ministries and agencies responsible for urban transition) with its relevant urban stakeholder organisations beyond the consortium partners and countries. To all project partners CapaCITIES offers dedicated services to in support of national change process. First, a transnational alliance for public authorities to exchange, learn and inspire each other in their transition towards climate neutral cities. Second, support in prototyping innovative multi-level and cross sector governance structures. Third, thematic capacity building for public authorities and support in taking effective local action and fourth, strategic synergies and access to other initiatives that address the climate neutral and smart cities mission.
project.title: Building Capacities for the Climate Neutral and Smart Cities Mission
project.keywords: smart cities mission, urban climate neutrality transitions, national change processes, innovative multi-level and cross sector governance structures, capacity building for public authorities

article.title: Supporting national authorities in the transition towards climate-neutral cities

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - CapaCITIES (Building Capacities for the Climate Neutral and Smart Cities Mission)
result.teaser: CapaCITIES is there to support, connect, empower and inspire national authorities, national ministries, funding agencies responsible for urban transitions from 15 EU countries in their efforts to build up the necessary national change processes. To this end, various measures...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Annual plan 2 for development and deployment of all activities and responsibilities including update DMP
result.description: This deliverable is the second iteration of the annual activity plan will be developed including Data Management Plan (DMP) (D2.1 and D2.2) to coordinate all activities (e.g. mappings, training, transition labs, platform events) and responsibilities (WP Leads and Core Country) over time.

result.title: Trainig materials on climate action MRV, modelling and innovation in impact assessment
result.description: Four Workshops held for core countries by ICLEI.

result.title: Newsletters
result.description: In M6, M12, M18 and M24 the project consortium has planned newsletters on the project activities, results and outcomes.

result.title: Mid-term Report
result.description: D1.1 Mid-term Report is a deliverable detailing on the progress of the work plan implementation and of the activities carried out in the first year of the project. The public version of this report will contain information on the progress of the activities carried out in the CapaCITIES core countries that might inspire other countries in their actions to support the cities in their fight towards climate neutrality.

result.title: Report on multi-level governance approaches in Core Countries to support the EU Cities mission
result.description: A report on the taccelerated learnings with all relevant stakeholders.

result.title: Data Management Plan (DMP)
result.description: This deliverable will details the procedures regarding data management in the project and will be updated across the project implementation.

result.title: Supporting materials for co-created interactive curriculum
result.description: Due in Month 13 and Month 18 - Training materials on climate action modelling and innovations in impact assessing.

result.title: Core country self-assessment mappings delivered by core countries
result.description: Report on the results of the capacity building sessions that will be made available for re-use and dissemination in core countries, following a ‘train-the-trainer' logic and approach.

result.title: Revised Data Management Plan (DMP)
result.description: A revised version of the DMP will be submitted by UEFISCDI in Month 22, after the project activities have been carried out.

result.title: Co-created Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan
result.description: The Communication, Dissemination and Exploitation Plan (C&D&E Plan) will be co-designed with all core countries. The C&D&E Plan relates to the annual activities plan (D2.1, D2.2) and aims to improve alignment, and strengthening synergies with other European, national and regional initiatives. It will be updated across the project implementation.

result.title: Annual portfolio of learning material year 1
result.description: A summary of the portfolio of learning material will be delivered to the EC on annual basis (D2.3, D2.4)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
